intro: Steinmannia flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green liverwort, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its small, closely packed leaves that are typically yellow-green in color. This plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in rocky or soil-covered areas. Its reproductive structures, known as sporophytes, are usually small and inconspicuous. Steinmannia flavovirens plays a role in soil stabilization and provides microhabitats for various invertebrates.
